intro: Huanuca, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plants typically grow in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine conditions. Huanuca species are often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in cool climates. They are valued for their ornamental beauty and are sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
